FR: Frérot prit sa soeurette par la main et dit:
GLOSS_LSF: FRERE SOEUR FRERE PRENDRE MAIN SOEUR
EN: The brother took his sister's hand and said to her,
GENERATED_EN: Brother took his sister by the hand and said:

FR: Depuis que notre mère est morte,
GLOSS_LSF: FRERE DIRE QUAND NOTRE MERE MORTE
EN: Since our mother died
GENERATED_EN: Since our mother died,

FR: nous ne connaissons plus que le malheur.
EN: we have had no good days;
GENERATED_EN: we only know misfortune.

FR: Notre belle-mère nous bat tous les jours
GLOSS_LSF: NOTRE BELLE MERE FRAPPER NOUS TOUS LES JOURS
EN: our stepmother beats us every day,
GENERATED_EN: Our mother-in-law beats us every day

FR: et quand nous voulons nous approcher d'elle, elle nous chasse à coups de pied.
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND NOUS APPROCHER ELLE ELLE COUP PIED NOUS
EN: and if we go near her she kicks us away;
GENERATED_EN: and when we want to approach her, she kicks us away.

FR: Pour nourriture, nous n'avons que de vieilles croûtes de pain,
GENERATED_LSF: NOURRITURE QUE VIEILLES CROUTES PAIN AVOIR
EN: we have nothing to eat but hard crusts of bread left over;
GENERATED_EN: For food, we have only old bread crusts,

FR: et le petit chien, sous la table, est plus gâté que nous;
GLOSS_LSF: LUI CHIEN PLUS GATER QUE NOUS
EN: the dog under the table fares better,
GENERATED_EN: and the little dog, under the table, is more spoiled than us;

FR: de temps à autre, elle lui jette quelques bons morceaux.
GLOSS_LSF: TEMPS EN TEMPS ELLE DONNER LUI BON MORCEAUX
EN: he gets a good piece every now and then.
GENERATED_EN: from time to time, she throws him a few good pieces.

FR: Si notre mère savait cela!
EN: If our mother only knew,
GENERATED_EN: If our mother knew that!

FR: Elle aurait pitié de nous!
EN: how she would pity us!
GENERATED_EN: She would have mercy on us!

FR: Viens, nous allons partir par le vaste monde!
EN: Come, let us go together out into the wide world!
GENERATED_EN: Come on, let's go to the wide world!

FR: Tout le jour ils marchèrent par les prés, les champs et les pierrailles
GLOSS_LSF: JOURNEE MARCHER PRES CHAMPS CHEMIN PIERRE
GENERATED_LSF: TOUT JOUR PRES MARCHER CHAMPS PIERRAILLES
EN: So they went, and journeyed the whole day through fields and meadows and stony places,
GENERATED_EN: All day long they walked through the meadows, fields and stones

FR: et quand la pluie se mit à tomber, soeurette dit:
EN: and if it rained the sister said,
GENERATED_EN: and when the rain began to fall, sis said:

FR: Le ciel et nos coeurs pleurent ensemble!
EN: The skies and we are weeping together.
GENERATED_EN: Heaven and our hearts cry together!

FR: Au soir, ils arrivèrent dans une grande forêt.
EN: In the evening they came to a great wood,
GENERATED_EN: In the evening, they arrived in a large forest.

FR: Ils étaient si épuisés de douleur, de faim et d'avoir si longtemps marché
GLOSS_LSF: TOUS DEUX FATIGUER DOULEUR FAIM TROP MARCHER
GENERATED_LSF: SI DOULEUR EPUISER FAIM SI LONGTEMPS MARCHE AVOIR
EN: and they were so weary with hunger and their long journey,
GENERATED_EN: They were so exhausted from pain and hunger and from walking so long

FR: qu'ils se blottirent au creux d'un arbre et s'endormirent.
EN: that they climbed up into a high tree and fell asleep.
GENERATED_EN: that they huddled in a tree and fell asleep.

FR: Quand ils se réveillèrent le lendemain matin,
EN: The next morning, when they awoke,
GENERATED_EN: When they woke up the next morning,

FR: le soleil était déjà haut dans le ciel
EN: the sun was high in heaven,
GENERATED_EN: the sun was already high in the sky

FR: et sa chaleur pénétrait la forêt.
EN: and shone brightly through the leaves.
GENERATED_EN: and its heat penetrated the forest.

FR: frérot dit à sa soeur:
EN: Then said the brother,
GENERATED_EN: brother says to his sister:

FR: Soeurette, j'ai soif.
EN: Sister, I am thirsty;
GENERATED_EN: Sis, I'm thirsty.

FR: Si je savais où il y a une source,
EN: if I only knew where to find a brook,
GENERATED_EN: If I knew where there was a source,

FR: j'y courrais pour y boire;
EN: that I might go and drink!
GENERATED_EN: I would run to it to drink;

FR: il me semble entendre murmurer un ruisseau.
EN: I almost think that I hear one rushing.
GENERATED_EN: it seems to me that I can hear a stream murmuring.

FR: Il se leva, prit Soeurette par la main
EN: So the brother got down and led his sister by the hand,
GENERATED_EN: He got up, took Soeurette by the hand

FR: et ils partirent tous deux à la recherche de la source.
EN: and they went to seek the brook.
GENERATED_EN: and they both went in search of the source.

FR: Leur méchante marâtre était en réalité une sorcière
EN: But their wicked stepmother was a witch,
GENERATED_EN: Their wicked stepmother was in fact a witch

FR: et elle avait vu partir les enfants.
EN: and had known quite well that the two children had run away,
GENERATED_EN: and she had seen the children leave.

FR: Elles les avait suivis en secret, sans bruit,
EN: and had sneaked after them,
GENERATED_EN: They had followed them secretly, without noise,

FR: à la manière des sorcières,
EN: as only witches can,
GENERATED_EN: in the manner of witches,

FR: et avait jeté un sort sur toutes les sources de la forêt.
EN: and had laid a spell on all the brooks in the forest.
GENERATED_EN: and had cast a spell on all the springs in the forest.

FR: Quand les deux enfants en découvrirent une qui coulait comme du vif argent sur les pierres,
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENFANTS DECOUVRIR EAU COULER NON ARGENT COULER
GENERATED_LSF: DEUX ENFANTS VIF ARGENT PIERRES DECOUVRIR COULER
EN: So when they found a little stream flowing smoothly over its pebbles,
GENERATED_EN: When the two children discovered one that flowed like quicksilver on the stones,

FR: Frérot voulut y boire.
EN: the brother was going to drink of it;
GENERATED_EN: Brother wanted to drink from it.

FR: Mais Soeurette entendit dans le murmure de l'eau une voix qui disait:
GLOSS_LSF: SOEUR ENTENDRE DANS RUISSEAU VOIX DIRE QUOI ?
GENERATED_LSF: SOEURETTE MURMURE EAU VOIX ENTENDIT DIRE
EN: but the sister heard how it said in its rushing,
GENERATED_EN: But Soeurette heard in the murmur of the water a voice saying:

FR: Qui me boit devient tigre.
GLOSS_LSF: VOIX DIRE PERSONNE BOIRE DEVENIR TIGRE
EN: He a tiger will be who drinks of me,
GENERATED_EN: Who drinks me becomes a tiger.

FR: Qui me boit devient tigre.
EN: Who drinks of me a tiger will be!
GENERATED_EN: Who drinks me becomes a tiger.

FR: Elle s'écria: Je t'en prie, Frérot, ne bois pas;
GLOSS_LSF: SOEUR CRIER S'IL TE PLAIT BOIRE PAS
GENERATED_LSF: ECRIER PRIE T' FREROT NE PAS BOIRE
EN: Then the sister cried, Pray, dear brother, do not drink,
GENERATED_EN: She exclaimed: Please, Brother, don't drink;

FR: sinon tu deviendras une bête sauvage
GLOSS_LSF: SI BOIRE TOI DEVENIR ANIMAL SAUVAGE
EN: or you will become a wild beast,
GENERATED_EN: otherwise you will become a wild beast

FR: qui me dévorera.
EN: and will tear me in pieces.
GENERATED_EN: that will devour me.

FR: Frérot ne but pas,
EN: So the brother refrained from drinking,
GENERATED_EN: Brother did not drink,

FR: malgré sa grande soif,
EN: though his thirst was great,
GENERATED_EN: despite his great thirst,

FR: et dit: J'attendrai jusqu'à la prochaine source.
GLOSS_LSF: FRERE DIRE ALORS ATTENDRE PROCHAIN RUISSEAU
EN: and he said he would wait till he came to the next brook.
GENERATED_EN: and said: I will wait until the next spring.

FR: Quand ils arrivèrent à la deuxième source,
EN: When they came to a second brook
GENERATED_EN: When they arrived at the second source,

FR: Soeurette l'entendit qui disait:
GLOSS_LSF: SOEUR ENTENDRE DANS RUISSEAU VOIX DIRE QUOI ?
EN: the sister heard it say,
GENERATED_EN: Sister heard him saying:

FR: Qui me boit devient loup.
GLOSS_LSF: VOIX DIRE PERSONNE BOIRE DEVENIR LOUP
EN: He a wolf will be who drinks of me,
GENERATED_EN: Who drinks me becomes a wolf.

FR: Qui me boit devient loup.
EN: Who drinks of me a wolf will be!
GENERATED_EN: Who drinks me becomes a wolf.

FR: Elle s'écria: Frérot, je t'en prie, ne bois pas
GLOSS_LSF: SOEUR CRIER S'IL TE PLAIT BOIRE PAS
GENERATED_LSF: ECRIER FREROT PRIE T' NE PAS BOIRE
EN: Then the sister cried, Pray, dear brother, do not drink,
GENERATED_EN: She exclaimed: Brother, I beg you, don't drink

FR: sinon tu deviendras un loup
EN: or you will be turned into a wolf,
GENERATED_EN: otherwise you will become a wolf

FR: et tu me mangeras.
EN: and will eat me up!
GENERATED_EN: and you will eat me.

FR: Frérot ne but pas et dit:
EN: So the brother refrained from drinking,
GENERATED_EN: Brother did not drink and said:

FR: J'attendrai que nous arrivions à une troisième source,
EN: and said, I will wait until we come to the next brook,
GENERATED_EN: I will wait until we get to a third source,

FR: mais alors je boirai, quoi que tu dises,
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS PROCHAINE MOI BOIRE MEME SI TOI REFUSER
EN: and then I must drink, whatever you say;
GENERATED_EN: but then I'll drink, no matter what you say,

FR: car ma soif est trop grande.
EN: my thirst is so great.
GENERATED_EN: because my thirst is too great.

FR: Quand ils arrivèrent à la troisième source, Soeurette entendit dans le murmure de l'eau
GLOSS_LSF: ARRIVER TROISIEME RUISSEAU SOEUR ENTENDRE DANS RUISSEAU VOIX DIRE QUOI ?
GENERATED_LSF: TROISIEME SOURCE ARRIVER SOEURETTE MURMURE EAU ENTENDIT
EN: And when they came to the third brook the sister heard how in its rushing it said,
GENERATED_EN: When they arrived at the third spring, Soeurette heard in the murmur of the water

FR: Qui me boit devient chevreuil.
GLOSS_LSF: VOIX DIRE PERSONNE BOIRE DEVENIR CHEVREUIL
EN: Who drinks of me a fawn will be,
GENERATED_EN: Who drinks me becomes a deer.

FR: Qui me boit devient chevreuil.
EN: He a fawn will be who drinks of me!
GENERATED_EN: Who drinks me becomes a deer.

FR: Elle dit: Ah! Frérot, je t'en prie, ne bois pas,
GLOSS_LSF: SOEUR DIRE S'IL TE PLAIT BOIRE PAS
GENERATED_LSF: DIRE AH FREROT PRIE T' NE PAS BOIRE
EN: Then the sister said, O my brother, I pray drink not,
GENERATED_EN: She said: Ah, Brother, please don't drink,

FR: sinon tu deviendras chevreuil et tu partiras loin de moi.
GLOSS_LSF: SI TOI BOIRE TOI DEVENIR CHEVREUIL TOI PARTIR LOIN
GENERATED_LSF: SINON CHEVREUIL TOI LOIN TU PARTIR
EN: or you will be turned into a fawn, and run away far from me.
GENERATED_EN: otherwise you will become a deer and you will go away from me.

FR: Mais déjà Frérot s'était agenouillé au bord de la source,
EN: But he had already kneeled by the side of the brook
GENERATED_EN: But already Brother had knelt down at the edge of the spring,

FR: déjà il s'était penché sur l'eau et il buvait.
EN: and stooped and drunk of the water,
GENERATED_EN: He had already leaned over the water and was drinking.

FR: Quand les premières gouttes touchèrent ses lèvres,
EN: and as the first drops passed his lips
GENERATED_EN: When the first drops touched his lips,

FR: il fut transformé en jeune chevreuil.
EN: he became a fawn.
GENERATED_EN: he was transformed into a young deer.

FR: Soeurette pleura sur le sort de Frérot
EN: And the sister wept over her poor lost brother,
GENERATED_EN: Sister wept over the fate of Brother

FR: et le petit chevreuil pleura aussi
EN: and the fawn wept also,
GENERATED_EN: and the little deer cried too

FR: et s'allongea tristement auprès d'elle.
EN: and stayed sadly beside her.
GENERATED_EN: and lay down sadly beside her.

FR: Finalement, la petite fille dit:
EN: At last the maiden said,
GENERATED_EN: Finally, the little girl said:

FR: Ne pleure pas cher petit chevreuil, je ne t'abandonnerai jamais.
GLOSS_LSF: PLEURE PAS MOI JAMAIS ABANDONNER TOI
GENERATED_LSF: NE PAS CHER PETIT CHEVREUIL PLEURE NE JAMAIS ABANDONNER
EN: Be comforted, dear fawn, indeed I will never leave you.
GENERATED_EN: Don't cry dear little deer, I will never leave you.

FR: Elle détacha sa jarretière d'or,
EN: Then she untied her golden girdle
GENERATED_EN: She untied her golden garter,

FR: la mit autour du cou du chevreuil,
EN: and bound it round the fawn's neck,
GENERATED_EN: put it around the neck of the deer,

FR: cueillit des joncs et en tressa une corde souple.
EN: and went and gathered rushes to make a soft cord,
GENERATED_EN: gathered rushes and wove them into a soft rope.

FR: Elle y attacha le petit animal
EN: which she fastened to him;
GENERATED_EN: She tied the little animal to it

FR: et ils s'enfoncèrent toujours plus avant dans la forêt.
EN: and then she led him on, and they went deeper into the forest.
GENERATED_EN: and they went deeper and deeper into the forest.

FR: Après avoir marché longtemps, longtemps,
EN: And when they had gone a long long way,
GENERATED_EN: After walking a long, long time,

FR: ils arrivèrent à une petite maison.
EN: they came at last to a little house,
GENERATED_EN: they arrived at a small house.

FR: La jeune fille regarda par la fenêtre
EN: and the maiden looked inside,
GENERATED_EN: The girl looked out the window

FR: et, voyant qu'elle était vide,
EN: and as it was empty
GENERATED_EN: and, seeing that it was empty,

FR: elle se dit:  Nous pourrions y habiter.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE PENSER POURQUOI PAS HABITER ICI
EN: she thought, We might as well live here.
GENERATED_EN: she thought: We could live there.

FR: Elle ramassa des feuilles et de la mousse et installa une couche bien douce pour le chevreuil.
GLOSS_LSF: FILLE RAMASSER FEUILLE MOUSSE INSTALLER COUCHE DOUCE POUR CHEVREUIL
GENERATED_LSF: FEUILLES MOUSSE COUCHE BIEN CHEVREUIL RAMASSER INSTALLER DOUCE
EN: And she fetched leaves and moss to make a soft bed for the fawn,
GENERATED_EN: She gathered leaves and moss and set up a soft bed for the deer.

FR: Chaque matin, elle faisait cueillette de racines,
EN: and every morning she went out and gathered roots
GENERATED_EN: Every morning, she picked roots,

FR: de baies et de noisettes pour elle
EN: and berries and nuts for herself,
GENERATED_EN: of berries and nuts for her

FR: et d'herbe tendre pour le chevreuil.
EN: and fresh grass for the fawn,
GENERATED_EN: and soft grass for the deer.

FR: Il la lui mangeait dans la main, était content
GLOSS_LSF: HERBE MAIN CHEVREUIL MANGER MAIN CHEVREUIL CONTENT
EN: who ate out of her hand with joy,
GENERATED_EN: He ate it out of her hand, was happy

FR: et folâtrait autour d'elle.
EN: frolicking round her.
GENERATED_EN: and frolicked around her.

FR: Le soir, quand Soeurette était fatiguée
EN: At night, when the sister was tired,
GENERATED_EN: In the evening, when Soeurette was tired

FR: et avait dit sa prière, elle appuyait sa tête sur le dos du chevreuil
GLOSS_LSF: PRIERE FINI CHEVREUIL DOS APPUYER SA TETE
GENERATED_LSF: PRIERE DIT TETE DOS CHEVREUIL APPUYER
EN: and had said her prayers, she laid her head on the fawn's back,
GENERATED_EN: and said her prayer, she leaned her head on the back of the deer

FR: qui lui servait d’oreiller
EN: which served her for a pillow,
GENERATED_EN: that served as a pillow

FR: et s'endormait doucement
EN: and softly fell asleep.
GENERATED_EN: and fell asleep slowly

FR: Leur existence eût été merveilleuse si Frérot avait eu son apparence humaine!
GLOSS_LSF: SI FRERE HUMAIN VIVRE ENCORE MIEUX
GENERATED_LSF: EXISTENCE FREROT APPARENCE HUMAINE MERVEILLEUSE EU
EN: And if only the brother could have got back his own shape again, it would have been a charming life.
GENERATED_EN: Their existence would have been wonderful if Brother had had his human appearance!

FR: Pendant quelque temps, ils vécurent ainsi dans la solitude.
GLOSS_LSF: PERIODE TEMPS TOUS DEUX VIVRE COMME CA
EN: So they lived a long while in the wilderness alone.
GENERATED_EN: For some time, they lived in solitude.

FR: Il arriva que le roi du pays donna une grande chasse dans la forêt.
GLOSS_LSF: TEMPS EN TEMPS ROI ORGANISER CHASSE FORET
GENERATED_LSF: ROI PAYS GRANDE CHASSE FORET ARRIVER DONNER
EN: Now it happened that the King of that country held a great hunt in the forest.
GENERATED_EN: It happened that the king of the country gave a great hunt in the forest.

FR: On entendit le son des trompes, la voix des chiens
EN: The blowing of the horns, the barking of the dogs,
GENERATED_EN: The sound of the horns was heard, the voice of the dogs

FR: et les joyeux appels des chasseurs à travers les arbres.
EN: and the lusty shouts of the huntsmen sounded through the wood,
GENERATED_EN: and the joyful calls of the hunters through the trees.

FR: Le petit chevreuil, à ce bruit, aurait bien voulu être de la fête.
GLOSS_LSF: CHEVREUIL ENTENDRE VOULOIR IMITER S'AMUSER AUSSI
GENERATED_LSF: PETIT CHEVREUIL BRUIT BIEN FETE VOULU
EN: and the fawn heard them and was eager to be among them.
GENERATED_EN: The little deer, at this noise, would have liked to be part of the party.

FR: Je t'en prie, Soeurette, laisse-moi aller à la chasse, dit-il;
GLOSS_LSF: GARCON DIRE S'IL TE PLAIT LAISSER MOI ALLER CHASSE
GENERATED_LSF: PRIE T' SOEURETTE CHASSE LAISSE ALLER DIRE
EN: Oh, said he to his sister, do let me go to the hunt;
GENERATED_EN: Please, Sis, let me go hunting," he said;

FR: je n'y tiens plus.
EN: I cannot stay behind any longer,
GENERATED_EN: I don't want it anymore.

FR: Il insista tant qu'elle finit par accepter.
EN: and begged so long that at last she consented.
GENERATED_EN: He insisted so much that she finally agreed.

FR: Mais, lui dit-elle, reviens ce soir sans faute.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS TOI REVENIR CE SOIR OBLIGER
EN: But mind, said she to him, come back to me at night.
GENERATED_EN: But, she said to him, come back tonight without fail.

FR: Par crainte des sauvages chasseurs, je fermerai ma porte.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI PEUR CHASSEUR SAUVAGE PORTE FERMER
EN: I must lock my door against the wild hunters,
GENERATED_EN: For fear of the savage hunters, I will close my door.

FR: A ton retour, pour que je te reconnaisse,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND TOI RENTRER MOI SAVOIR SI TOI OUI NON
EN: so, in order that I may know you,
GENERATED_EN: When you come back, so I can recognize you,

FR: frappe et dis  Soeurette, laisse-moi entrer.
GLOSS_LSF: TOI PORTE FRAPPER DIRE MA SOEUR S'IL TE PLAIT LAISSER MOI ENTRER
EN: you must knock and say, Little sister, let me in,
GENERATED_EN: knock and say Sis, let me in.

FR: Si tu n'agis pas ainsi, je n'ouvrirai pas.
GLOSS_LSF: SI TOI DIRE RIEN MOI PORTE PAS OUVRIR
EN: and unless I hear that I shall not unlock the door.
GENERATED_EN: If you don't do this, I won't open.

FR: Le petit chevreuil s'élança dehors,
EN: Then the fawn sprang out,
GENERATED_EN: The little deer ran outside,

FR: tout joyeux de se trouver en liberté.
EN: and felt glad and merry in the open air.
GENERATED_EN: all happy to be free.

FR: Le roi et ses chasseurs virent le joli petit animal,
GENERATED_LSF: ROI CHASSEURS JOLI PETIT ANIMAL VOIR
EN: The King and his huntsmen saw the beautiful animal,
GENERATED_EN: The king and his hunters saw the cute little animal,

FR: le poursuivirent,
EN: and began at once to pursue him,
GENERATED_EN: pursued him,

FR: mais ne parvinrent pas à le rattraper.
EN: but they could not come within reach of him,
GENERATED_EN: but were unable to catch up with him.

FR: Chaque fois qu'ils croyaient le tenir, il sautait par-dessus les buissons et disparaissait.
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND PRESQUE ATTRAPER BUISSON SAUTER DISPARAITRE
GENERATED_LSF: FOIS CROIRE TENIR DESSUS BUISSONS SAUTER DISPARAITRE
EN: for when they thought they were certain of him he sprang away over the bushes and disappeared.
GENERATED_EN: Every time they thought they had him, he would jump over the bushes and disappear.

FR: Quand vint le soir, il courut à la maison, frappa et dit:
GLOSS_LSF: SOIR TOMBER CHEVREUIL MAISON COURIR PORTE FRAPPPER
GENERATED_LSF: SOIR VENIR MAISON COURIR FRAPPA DIT
EN: As soon as it was dark he went back to the little house, knocked at the door, and said,
GENERATED_EN: When evening came, he ran to the house, knocked and said:

FR: Soeurette, laisse-moi entrer!
GLOSS_LSF: CHEVREUIL DIRE MA SOEUR S'IL TE PLAIT LAISSER MOI ENTRER
EN: Little sister, let me in.
GENERATED_EN: Sis, let me in!

FR: La porte lui fut ouverte,
EN: Then the door was opened to him,
GENERATED_EN: The door was opened for him,

FR: il entra
EN: and he went in,
GENERATED_EN: he entered

FR: et se reposa toute la nuit sur sa couche moelleuse.
GLOSS_LSF: COUCHE MOELLEUSE COUCHER DESSUS REPOSER TOUTE NUIT
EN: and rested the whole night long on his soft bed.
GENERATED_EN: and rested all night on his soft bed.

FR: Le lendemain matin, la chasse recommença
EN: The next morning the hunt began anew,
GENERATED_EN: The next morning, the hunt began again

FR: et le petit chevreuil entendit le son des cors et les  Oh! Oh!  des chasseurs. Il ne put résister.
GLOSS_LSF: CHEVREUIL ENTENDRE CORS CHASSEUR CRIER CHEVREUIL PAS RESTER
GENERATED_LSF: PETIT CHEVREUIL CORS OH OH CHASSEURS ENTENDRE NE PUT RESISTER
EN: and when the fawn heard the hunting-horns and the tally-ho of the huntsmen he could rest no longer,
GENERATED_EN: and the little deer heard the sound of horns and the Oh! Oh! of the hunters. He could not resist.

FR: Soeurette, ouvre, ouvre, il faut que je sorte! dit-il.
GLOSS_LSF: GARCON DIRE S'IL TE PLAIT PORTE OUVRIR MOI SORTIR
GENERATED_LSF: SOEURETTE OUVRIR OUVRIR FALLOIR SORTIR DIRE
EN: and said, Little sister, let me out, I must go
GENERATED_EN: Sis, open, open, I have to go out! he said.

FR: Soeurette ouvrit et lui dit:
EN: The sister opened the door and said,
GENERATED_EN: Sis opened the door and told her:

FR: Mais ce soir il faut que tu reviennes et que tu dises les mêmes mots qu'hier.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS CE SOIR QUAND TOI REVENIR DIRE MOI MEME QU'HIER
GENERATED_LSF: SOIR TOI REVIENNES TOI DISES MEMES MOTS HIER FALLOIR
EN: Now, mind you must come back at night and say the same words.
GENERATED_EN: But tonight you have to come back and say the same words as yesterday.

FR: Quand le roi et ses chasseurs revirent le petit chevreuil au collier d'or,
GENERATED_LSF: ROI CHASSEURS PETIT CHEVREUIL COLLIER OR REVOIR
EN: When the King and his hunters saw the fawn with the golden collar again,
GENERATED_EN: When the king and his hunters saw the little deer with the golden collar again,

FR: ils le poursuivirent à nouveau. Mais il était trop rapide, trop agile.
GENERATED_LSF: POURSUIVIRENT NOUVEAU TROP RAPIDE TROP AGILE
EN: they chased him closely, but he was too nimble and swift for them.
GENERATED_EN: they chased him again. But he was too fast, too agile.

FR: Cela dura toute la journée. Vers le soir, les chasseurs finirent par le cerner
GLOSS_LSF: JOURNEE SUIVRE SOIR CHASSEUR CHEVREUIL CERNER
GENERATED_LSF: TOUTE JOURNEE DURER SOIR CHASSEURS FINIR CERNER
EN: This lasted the whole day, and at last the hunters surrounded him,
GENERATED_EN: This went on all day. Towards the evening, the hunters finally surrounded him

FR: et l'un d'eux le blessa légèrement au pied,
EN: and one of them wounded his foot a little,
GENERATED_EN: and one of them slightly injured his foot,

FR: si bien qu'il boitait et ne pouvait plus aller que lentement.
GENERATED_LSF: BIEN NE PLUS LENTEMENT BOITER POUVOIR ALLER
EN: so that he was obliged to limp and to go slowly.
GENERATED_EN: so that he limped and could only go slowly.

FR: Un chasseur le suivit jusqu'à la petite maison
GLOSS_LSF: CHEVREUIL SA MAISON RENTRER CHASSEUR SUIVRE
EN: Then a hunter slipped after him to the little house,
GENERATED_EN: A hunter followed him to the little house

FR: et l'entendit dire: Soeurette, laisse-moi entrer!
GLOSS_LSF: CHASSEUR ENTENDRE CHEVREUIL DIRE MA SOEUR S'IL TE PLAIT LAISSER MOI ENTRER
EN: and heard how he called out, Little sister, let me in,
GENERATED_EN: and heard her say: "Sister, let me in!

FR: Il vit que l'on ouvrait la porte et qu'elle se refermait aussitôt.
EN: and saw the door open and shut again after him directly.,
GENERATED_EN: He saw that the door was opened and immediately closed.

FR: Il enregistra cette scène dans sa mémoire,
EN: The hunter noticed all this carefully,
GENERATED_EN: He recorded this scene in his memory,

FR: alla chez le roi
EN: went to the King,
GENERATED_EN: went to the king

FR: et lui raconta ce qu'il avait vu et entendu.
GLOSS_LSF: RACONTER MOI VOIR CA ENTENDRE CA
EN: and told him all he had seen and heard.
GENERATED_EN: and told him what he had seen and heard.

FR: Alors le roi dit:
EN: Then said the King,
GENERATED_EN: Then the king says:

FR: Demain nous chasserons encore!
EN: Tomorrow we will hunt again.
GENERATED_EN: Tomorrow we will hunt again!

FR: Soeurette avait été fort affligée de voir que son petit chevreuil était blessé.
GENERATED_LSF: SOEURETTE FORT PETIT CHEVREUIL AFFLIGEE VOIR BLESSE
EN: But the sister was very terrified when she saw that her fawn was wounded.
GENERATED_EN: Sister was very sad to see that her little deer was injured.

FR: Elle épongea le sang qui coulait,
EN: She washed his foot,
GENERATED_EN: She sponged the blood that was flowing,

FR: mit des herbes sur la blessure
EN: laid cooling leaves round it,
GENERATED_EN: put herbs on the wound

FR: et dit: Va te coucher, cher petit chevreuil, pour que tu guérisses bien vite.
GLOSS_LSF: BON TOI ALLER COUCHER FAUT GUERIR BIEN VITE
GENERATED_LSF: DIT TOI ALLER COUCHER CHER PETIT CHEVREUIL TOI GUERISSES BIEN VITE
EN: and said, Lie down on your bed, dear fawn, and rest, that you may be soon well.
GENERATED_EN: and said: Go to bed, dear little deer, so that you get well soon.

FR: La blessure était si insignifiante qu'au matin il ne s'en ressentait plus du tout.
GLOSS_LSF: BLESSURE ELLE PETITE LENDEMAIN MATIN CHEVREUIL MAL FINIR
GENERATED_LSF: BLESSURE SI INSIGNIFIANTE MATIN NE PLUS TOUT RESSENTIR
EN: The wound was very slight, so that the fawn felt nothing of it the next morning.
GENERATED_EN: The wound was so insignificant that by morning he didn't feel it at all.

FR: Quand il entendit de nouveau la chasse
EN: And when he heard the noise of the hunting outside,
GENERATED_EN: When he heard the hunt again

FR: il dit: Je n'y tiens plus! Il faut que j'y sois!
EN: he said, I cannot stay in, I must go after them;
GENERATED_EN: he says: I don't want to be there anymore! I have to be there!

FR: Ils ne m'auront pas.
EN: I shall not be taken easily again!
GENERATED_EN: They won't get me.

FR: Soeurette pleura
EN: The sister began to weep,
GENERATED_EN: Sister cried

FR: et dit: Ils vont te tuer
EN: and said, I know you will be killed,
GENERATED_EN: and said: They will kill you

FR: et je serai seule dans la forêt,
EN: and I left alone here in the forest,
GENERATED_EN: and I will be alone in the forest,

FR: abandonnée de tous.
EN: and forsaken of everybody.
GENERATED_EN: abandoned by all.

FR: Je ne te laisserai pas sortir!
EN: I cannot let you go!
GENERATED_EN: I won't let you out!

FR: Alors je mourrai ici de tristesse,répondit le chevreuil.
GLOSS_LSF: CHEVREUIL DIRE OK ALORS MOI MOURIR ICI PAR TRISTE
GENERATED_LSF: ALORS ICI TRISTESSE MOURIR CHEVREUIL REPONDRE
EN: Then I shall die here with longing, answered the fawn;
GENERATED_EN: Then I will die here of sadness, replied the deer.

FR: Quand j'entends le cor, j'ai l'impression que je vais bondir hors de mes sabots.
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND MOI ENTENDRE BRUIT COR MOI PRET BONDIR
GENERATED_LSF: COR ENTENDRE IMPRESSION SABOTS AVOIR ALLER BONDIR
EN: when I hear the sound of the horn I feel as if I should leap out of my skin.
GENERATED_EN: When I hear the horn, I feel like I'm going to jump out of my hooves.

FR: Soeurette n'y pouvait plus rien.
GLOSS_LSF: SOEUR PAS POUVOIR VOIR LUI COMME CA
EN: Then the sister, seeing there was no help for it,
GENERATED_EN: Soeurette could not do anything more.

FR: Le coeur lourd, elle ouvrit la porte
EN: unlocked the door with a heavy heart,
GENERATED_EN: With a heavy heart, she opened the door

FR: et le petit chevreuil partit joyeux dans la forêt.
EN: and the fawn bounded away into the forest, well and merry.
GENERATED_EN: and the little deer went happily into the forest.

FR: Quand le roi le vit, il dit à ses chasseurs:
GLOSS_LSF: ROI APERCEVOIR LUI ROI DIRE VOUS CHASSEUR
EN: When the King saw him, he said to his hunters,
GENERATED_EN: When the king saw him, he said to his hunters:

FR: Poursuivez-le sans répit tout le jour,
EN: Now, follow him up all day long till the night comes,
GENERATED_EN: Chase him relentlessly all day,

FR: mais que personne ne lui fasse de mal!
EN: and see that you do him no hurt.
GENERATED_EN: but don't let anyone hurt him!

FR: Quand le soleil fut couché,
EN: So as soon as the sun had gone down,
GENERATED_EN: When the sun went down,

FR: il dit à l'un des chasseurs:
EN: the King said to the huntsmen:
GENERATED_EN: he said to one of the hunters:

FR: Maintenant tu vas me montrer la petite maison!
EN: Now, come and show me the little house in the wood.
GENERATED_EN: Now you will show me the little house!

FR: Quand il fut devant la porte, il frappa
GLOSS_LSF: ARRIVER PORTE MAISON CHASSEUR PORTE FRAPPER
EN: And when he got to the door he knocked at it,
GENERATED_EN: When he was in front of the door, he knocked

FR: et dit: Soeurette, laisse-moi entrer!
GLOSS_LSF: CHASSEUR DIRE MA SOEUR S'IL TE PLAIT LAISSER MOI ENTRER
EN: and cried, Little sister, let me in!
GENERATED_EN: and said: Sis, let me in!

FR: La porte s'ouvrit et le roi entra.
EN: Then the door opened, and the King went in,
GENERATED_EN: The door opened and the king entered.

FR: Il aperçut une jeune fille si belle qu'il n'en avait jamais vu de pareille.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI VOIR FILLE BELLE JAMAIS VOIR AUTRE PLUS BELLE QU'ELLE
GENERATED_LSF: JEUNE FILLE BELLE JAMAIS PAREILLE APERCEVOIR VU
EN: and there stood a maiden more beautiful than any he had seen before.
GENERATED_EN: He saw a young girl so beautiful that he had never seen one like her.

FR: Quand elle vit que ce n'était pas le chevreuil, mais un homme portant une couronne d'or sur la tête qui entrait, elle prit peur.
GLOSS_LSF: FILLE VOIR PAS CHEVREUIL MAIS GRAND HOMME COURONNE PORTER TETE ENTRER FILLE PEUR
GENERATED_LSF: PAS CHEVREUIL VOIR HOMME COURONNE OR TETE PORTANT ENTRER PEUR PRENDRE
EN: The maiden shrieked out when she saw, instead of the fawn, a man standing there with a gold crown on his head.
GENERATED_EN: When she saw that it was not the deer, but a man wearing a golden crown on his head who entered, she was afraid.

FR: Mais le roi la regardait avec amitié, lui tendit la main
GLOSS_LSF: ROI REGARDER FILLE TENDREMENT MAIN TENDRE
EN: But the King looked kindly on her, took her by the hand,
GENERATED_EN: But the king looked at her with friendship, held out his hand

FR: et dit: Veux-tu venir à mon château et devenir ma femme?
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE TOI VOULOIR DEVENIR MA FEMME?
GENERATED_LSF: DIT VEUX CHATEAU FEMME VENIR DEVENIR
EN: and said, Will you go with me to my castle, and be my dear wife?
GENERATED_EN: and said, "Will you come to my castle and become my wife?

FR: Oh! oui, répondit la jeune fille,
EN: Oh yes, answered the maiden,
GENERATED_EN: Oh, yes," said the girl,

FR: mais il faut que le chevreuil vienne avec moi,
EN: but the fawn must come too.
GENERATED_EN: but I need the deer to come with me,

FR: je ne l'abandonnerai pas.
EN: I could not leave him.
GENERATED_EN: I will not abandon it.

FR: Le roi dit: Il restera avec toi aussi longtemps que tu vivras
GLOSS_LSF: ROI REPONDRE LUI RESTER AVEC TOI JUSQU’A TOI MOURIR
GENERATED_LSF: ROI DIT TOI AUSSI LONGTEMPS RESTER VIVRE
EN: And the King said, He shall remain with you as long as you live,
GENERATED_EN: The king said, "He will stay with you as long as you live

FR: et il ne manquera de rien.
EN: and shall lack nothing.
GENERATED_EN: and he will not lack anything.

FR: Au même instant, le chevreuil arriva.
EN: Then the fawn came bounding in,
GENERATED_EN: At the same time, the deer arrived.

FR: Soeurette lui passa sa laisse et,
EN: and the sister tied the cord of rushes to him,
GENERATED_EN: Sis passed him his leash and,

FR: la tenant elle-même à la main, quitta la petite maison.
EN: and led him by her own hand out of the little house.
GENERATED_EN: holding it in her hand, left the little house.

FR: Le roi prit la jeune fille sur son cheval
EN: The King put the beautiful maiden on his horse,
GENERATED_EN: The king took the girl on his horse

FR: et la conduisit dans son château
EN: and carried her to his castle,
GENERATED_EN: and took her to his castle

FR: où leurs noces furent célébrées en grande pompe.
EN: where the wedding was held with great pomp;
GENERATED_EN: where their wedding was celebrated with great pomp.

FR: Soeurette devint donc altesse royale
EN: so she became lady Queen,
GENERATED_EN: Soeurette became a royal highness

FR: et ils vécurent ensemble et heureux de longues années durant.
EN: and they lived together happily for a long while;
GENERATED_EN: and they lived together happily for many years.

FR: On était aux petits soins pour le chevreuil
EN: the fawn was well tended and cherished,
GENERATED_EN: We took care of the deer

FR: qui avait tout loisir de gambader dans le parc clôturé.
EN: and he gambolled about the castle garden.
GENERATED_EN: who had all the time in the world to play in the fenced park.

FR: Cependant, la marâtre méchante,
EN: Now the wicked stepmother,
GENERATED_EN: However, the wicked stepmother,

FR: à cause de qui les enfants étaient partis par le monde,
EN: whose fault it was that the children were driven out into the world,
GENERATED_EN: because of whom the children had gone out into the world,

FR: s'imaginait que Soeurette avait été mangée par les bêtes sauvages de la forêt
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE IMAGINER SOEUR ANIMAUX MANGER ELLE
GENERATED_LSF: SOEURETTE BETES SAUVAGES FORET IMAGINER MANGEE
EN: never dreamed but that the sister had been eaten up by wild beasts in the forest,
GENERATED_EN: imagined that Soeurette had been eaten by the wild beasts of the forest

FR: et que Frérot,
EN: and that the brother,
GENERATED_EN: and that Frérot,

FR: transformé en chevreuil,
EN: in the likeness of a fawn,
GENERATED_EN: turned into a deer,

FR: avait été tué par les chasseurs.
EN: had been slain by the hunters.
GENERATED_EN: had been killed by the hunters.

FR: Quand elle apprit que tous deux vivaient heureux,
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS QUAND ELLE APPRENDRE TOUS DEUX VIVRE HEUREUX
EN: But when she heard that they were so happy,
GENERATED_EN: When she learned that they were both living happily,

FR: l'envie et la jalousie remplirent son coeur
EN: jealousy and envy arose in her heart,
GENERATED_EN: envy and jealousy filled his heart

FR: et ne la laissèrent plus en repos.
EN: and left her no peace,
GENERATED_EN: and did not let her rest.

FR: Elle n'avait d'autre idée en tête que de les rendre malgré tout malheureux.
GENERATED_LSF: AUTRE IDEE TETE MALHEUREUX AVOIR RENDRE
EN: and her chief thought was how to bring misfortune upon them.
GENERATED_EN: She had no other idea in mind than to make them unhappy despite everything.

FR: Et sa véritable fille, qui était laide comme la nuit
EN: Her own daughter, who was as ugly as sin,
GENERATED_EN: And his real daughter, who was ugly as night

FR: et n'avait qu'un oeil,
EN: and had only one eye, complained to her,
GENERATED_EN: and had only one eye,

FR: lui faisait des reproches, disant: C'est moi qui aurais dû devenir reine!
GENERATED_LSF: REPROCHES FAIRE DISANT DU REINE DEVENIR
EN: and said, I never had the chance of being a Queen.
GENERATED_EN: reproached her, saying: I should have become queen!

FR: Sois tranquille! disait la vieille.
EN: Never mind, said the old woman, to satisfy her;
GENERATED_EN: Be quiet! said the old woman.

FR: Lorsque le moment viendra,
EN: when the time comes,
GENERATED_EN: When the time comes,

FR: je m'en occuperai.
EN: I shall be at hand.
GENERATED_EN: I will take care of it.

FR: Le temps passa et la reine mit au monde un beau petit garçon.
GLOSS_LSF: ANNEE PASSER REINE NAITRE BEAU PETIT GARCON
GENERATED_LSF: TEMPS PASSA REINE MONDE BEAU PETIT GARCON METTRE
EN: After a while the Queen brought a beautiful baby-boy into the world,
GENERATED_EN: Time passed and the queen gave birth to a beautiful baby boy.

FR: Le roi était justement à la chasse.
EN: and that day the King was out hunting.
GENERATED_EN: The king was hunting.

FR: La vieille sorcière prit l'apparence d'une camériste,
EN: The old witch took the shape of the bedchamber woman,
GENERATED_EN: The old hag took on the appearance of a chambermaid,

FR: pénétra dans la chambre où se trouvait la reine
EN: and went into the room where the Queen lay,
GENERATED_EN: entered the room where the queen was

FR: et lui dit:
EN: and said to her,
GENERATED_EN: and said to him:

FR: Venez, votre bain est prêt.
EN: Come, the bath is ready;
GENERATED_EN: Come, your bath is ready.

FR: Il vous fera du bien et vous donnera des forces nouvelles.
EN: it will give you refreshment and new strength.
GENERATED_EN: It will do you good and give you new strength.

FR: Faites vite avant que l'eau ne refroidisse.
EN: Quick, or it will be cold.
GENERATED_EN: Be quick before the water gets cold.

FR: Sa fille était également dans la place.
EN: Her daughter was within call,
GENERATED_EN: His daughter was also in the place.

FR: Elles portèrent la reine affaiblie dans la salle de bains
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX PORTER REINE JUSQU’A SALLE DE BAIN
EN: so they carried the sick Queen into the bath-room,
GENERATED_EN: They carried the weakened queen to the bathroom

FR: et la déposèrent dans la baignoire. Puis elles fermèrent la porte à clef et s'en allèrent.
GLOSS_LSF: POSER REINE DANS BAIN PORTE FERMER CLE DEUX PARTIR
GENERATED_LSF: DEPOSERENT BAIGNOIRE PORTE CLEF ALLERENT FERMER
EN: and left her there.
GENERATED_EN: and put her in the bathtub. Then they locked the door and left.

FR: Dans la salle de bains, elles avaient allumé un feu d'enfer,
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX DANS SALLE DE BAIN ALLUMER FEU FORT
EN: And in the bath-room they had made a great fire,
GENERATED_EN: In the bathroom, they had lit a fire of hell,

FR: pensant que la reine étoufferait rapidement.
EN: so as to suffocate the beautiful young Queen.
GENERATED_EN: thinking that the queen would suffocate quickly.

FR: Ayant agi ainsi,
EN: When that was managed,
GENERATED_EN: Having done so,

FR: la vieille coiffa sa fille d'un béguin
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE COIFFER SA FILLE COMME REINE
EN: the old woman took her daughter, put a cap on her,
GENERATED_EN: the old lady capped her daughter with a crush

FR: et la fit coucher dans le lit, à la place de la reine
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE METTRE SA FILLE DANS LIT A LA PLACE REINE
EN: and laid her in the bed in the Queen's place,
GENERATED_EN: and made her lie in bed, in the place of the queen

FR: dont elle lui avait donné la taille et l'apparence.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIER SORT SA FILLE DEVENIR REINE
EN: gave her also the Queen's form and countenance,
GENERATED_EN: of which she had given him the size and the appearance.

FR: Mais elle n'avait pu remplacer oeil qui lui manquait.
EN: only she could not restore the lost eye.
GENERATED_EN: But she had not been able to replace the eye that she missed.

FR: Pour que le roi ne s'en aperçût pas,
EN: So, in order that the King might not remark it,
GENERATED_EN: So that the king would not notice,

FR: elle lui ordonna de se coucher sur le côté où elle n'avait pas oeil.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIER ORDONNER FILLE COUCHER COTE MANQUE OEIL
EN: she had to lie on the side where there was no eye.
GENERATED_EN: she ordered him to lie on the side where she had no eye.

FR: Le soir, quand le roi revint et apprit qu'un fils lui était né,
GLOSS_LSF: SOIR ROI REVENIR LUI APPRENDRE FILS NE
GENERATED_LSF: SOIR ROI REVINT FILS APPRIT NE
EN: In the evening, when the King came home and heard that a little son was born to him,
GENERATED_EN: In the evening, when the king returned and learned that a son had been born to him,

FR: il se réjouit en son coeur
EN: he rejoiced with all his heart,
GENERATED_EN: he rejoices in his heart

FR: et voulut se rendre auprès de sa chère épouse pour prendre de ses nouvelles.
GLOSS_LSF: VITE VOIR SA FEMME POUR SAVOIR NOUVELLE
GENERATED_LSF: AUPRES CHERE EPOUSE NOUVELLES VOULOIR RENDRE PRENDRE
EN: and was going at once to his dear wife's bedside to see how she did.
GENERATED_EN: and wanted to go to his beloved wife to check on her.

FR: La vieille s'écria aussitôt:
EN: Then the old woman cried hastily,
GENERATED_EN: The old woman immediately cried out:

FR: Prenez bien garde de laisser les rideaux tirés;
GENERATED_LSF: PRENEZ BIEN GARDE RIDEAUX LAISSER TIRES
EN: For your life, do not draw back the curtains, to let in the light upon her;
GENERATED_EN: Be careful to leave the curtains drawn;

FR: la reine ne doit voir aucune lumière elle doit se reposer!
GLOSS_LSF: REINE INTERDIT VOIR LUMIERE ELLE REPOSER
GENERATED_LSF: REINE NE LUMIERE DEVOIR VOIR DEVOIR REPOSER
EN: she must be kept quiet.
GENERATED_EN: the queen must not see any light she must rest!

FR: Le roi se retira.
EN: So the King went away,
GENERATED_EN: The king withdrew.

FR: Il ne vit pas qu'une fausse reine était couchée dans le lit.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI PAS SE RENDRE COMPE FAUSSE REINE DANS LIT
GENERATED_LSF: NE PAS FAUSSE REINE LIT VOIR COUCHEE
EN: and never knew that a false Queen was lying in the bed.
GENERATED_EN: He did not see that a false queen was lying in the bed.

FR: Quand vint minuit et que tout fut endormi,
EN: Now, when it was midnight, and every one was asleep,
GENERATED_EN: When midnight came and all was asleep,

FR: la nourrice, qui se tenait auprès du berceau dans la chambre d'enfant et qui seule veillait encore,
GLOSS_LSF: NOURRICE A COTE BERCEAU SURVEILLER BEBE PAS DORMIR
GENERATED_LSF: NOURRICE AUPRES BERCEAU CHAMBRE ENFANT SEULE ENCORE TENIR VEILLER
EN: the nurse, who was sitting by the cradle in the nursery and watching there alone,
GENERATED_EN: the nurse, who was standing by the cradle in the nursery and who alone was still watching,

FR: vit la porte s'ouvrir
EN: saw the door open,
GENERATED_EN: saw the door open

FR: et la vraie reine entrer.
EN: and the true Queen come in.
GENERATED_EN: and the real queen enter.

FR: Elle sortit l'enfant du berceau,
EN: She took the child out of the cradle,
GENERATED_EN: She took the child out of the cradle,

FR: le prit dans ses bras et lui donna à boire.
EN: laid it in her bosom, and fed it.
GENERATED_EN: took him in his arms and gave him a drink.

FR: Puis elle tapota son oreiller,
EN: Then she shook out its little pillow,
GENERATED_EN: Then she patted her pillow,

FR: le recoucha, le couvrit et étendit le couvre-pieds.
EN: put the child back again, and covered it with the coverlet.
GENERATED_EN: laid him back down, covered him and spread the foot cover.

FR: Elle n'oublia pas non plus le petit chevreuil,
GENERATED_LSF: OUBLIA PAS NON PLUS PETIT CHEVREUIL
EN: She did not forget the fawn either:
GENERATED_EN: She did not forget the little deer either,

FR: s'approcha du coin où il dormait
EN: she went to him where he lay in the corner,
GENERATED_EN: approached the corner where he was sleeping

FR: et le caressa.
EN: and stroked his back tenderly.
GENERATED_EN: and caressed him.

FR: Puis, sans bruit, elle ressortit
EN: Then she went in perfect silence out at the door,
GENERATED_EN: Then, without a sound, she went out

FR: et, le lendemain matin, lorsque la nourrice demanda aux gardes s'ils n'avaient vu personne entrer au château durant la nuit,
GLOSS_LSF: LENDEMAIN MATIN NOURRICE DEMANDER GARDE VOUS VOIR PERSONNE ENTRER DANS CHATEAU NUIT
GENERATED_LSF: LENDEMAIN MATIN NOURRICE DEMANDA GARDES PERSONNE CHATEAU NUIT VU ENTRER
EN: and the nurse next morning asked the watchmen if any one had entered the castle during the night,
GENERATED_EN: and, the next morning, when the nurse asked the guards if they had seen anyone enter the castle during the night,

FR: ceux-ci répondirent: Non, nous n'avons vu personne.
GLOSS_LSF: GARDE REPONDRE NON NON NOUS VOIR PERSONNE
EN: but they said they had seen no one.
GENERATED_EN: They answered: No, we have not seen anyone.

FR: La reine vint ainsi chaque nuit,
EN: And the Queen came many nights,
GENERATED_EN: The queen came every night,

FR: toujours silencieuse.
EN: and never said a word;
GENERATED_EN: always silent.

FR: La nourrice la voyait bien,
EN: the nurse saw her always,
GENERATED_EN: The nanny could see it well,

FR: mais elle n'osait en parler à personne.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS NOURRICE PAS OSER DIRE QUELQU'UN
EN: but she did not dare speak of it to any one.
GENERATED_EN: but she didn't dare tell anyone.

FR: Au bout d'un certain temps,
EN: After some time had gone by in this manner,
GENERATED_EN: After a while,

FR: la reine commença à parler dans la nuit et dit:
EN: the Queen seemed to find voice, and said one night,
GENERATED_EN: the queen began to speak in the night and said:

FR: Que devient mon enfant? Que devient mon chevreuil?
GLOSS_LSF: MON ENFANT DEVENIR QUOI ? MON CHEVREUIL DEVENIR QUOI ?
EN: My child my fawn twice more I come to see,
GENERATED_EN: What happens to my child? What happens to my deer?

FR: Deux fois encore je reviendrai; ensuite plus jamais.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX FOIS MOI REVENIR MAIS APRES JAMAIS REVENIR
GENERATED_LSF: DEUX FOIS ENCORE REVENIR ENSUITE PLUS JAMAIS
EN: Twice more I come, and then the end must be.
GENERATED_EN: Twice more I will come back; then never again.

FR: La nourrice ne lui répondit pas. Mais quand elle eut disparu,
GLOSS_LSF: NOURRICE SE TAIRE MAIS QUAND REINE DISPARAITRE
EN: The nurse said nothing, but as soon as the Queen had disappeared
GENERATED_EN: The nanny did not answer him. But when she had disappeared,

FR: elle alla trouver le roi et lui raconta tout.
EN: she went to the King and told him all.
GENERATED_EN: she went to the king and told him everything.

FR: Le roi dit alors: Mon Dieu, que signifie cela?
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE MON DIEU MAIS C'EST QUOI CA ?
EN: The King said, Ah, heaven! what do I hear!
GENERATED_EN: The king then says: My God, what does this mean?

FR: Je veillerai la nuit prochaine auprès de l'enfant.
EN: I will myself watch by the child to-morrow night.
GENERATED_EN: I will stay up next night with the child.

FR: Le soir, il se rendit auprès du berceau
GLOSS_LSF: SOIR ROI RESTER A COTE BERCEAU
EN: So at evening he went into the nursery,
GENERATED_EN: In the evening, he went to the cradle

FR: et, à minuit, la reine parut et dit à nouveau:
EN: and at midnight the Queen appeared, and said,
GENERATED_EN: and, at midnight, the queen appeared and said again

FR: Que devient mon enfant? Que devient mon chevreuil?
GLOSS_LSF: MON ENFANT DEVENIR QUOI ? MON CHEVREUIL DEVENIR QUOI ?
EN: My child my fawn once more I come to see,
GENERATED_EN: What happens to my child? What happens to my deer?

FR: Une fois encore je reviendrai ensuite plus jamais.
GLOSS_LSF: UNE FOIS MOI REVENIR MAIS APRES JAMAIS REVENIR
GENERATED_LSF: FOIS ENCORE ENSUITE PLUS JAMAIS REVENIR
EN: Once more I come, and then the end must be.
GENERATED_EN: Once again I will come back then never again.

FR: Elle s'occupa de l'enfant comme à l'ordinaire avant de disparaître.
GLOSS_LSF: REINE S'OCCUPER ENFANT COMME D'HABITUDE APRES DISPARAITRE
EN: And she tended the child, as she was accustomed to do, before she vanished.
GENERATED_EN: She took care of the child as usual before disappearing.

FR: Le roi n'osa pas lui parler, mais il veilla encore la nuit suivante. De nouveau elle dit:
GLOSS_LSF: ROI PAS OSER PARLER MAIS NUIT SUIVANTE LUI VEILLER ENCORE REINE ENCORE DIRE
GENERATED_LSF: ROI PAS OSER PARLER ENCORE NUIT SUIVANTE VEILLER NOUVEAU DIRE
EN: The King dared not speak to her, but he watched again the following night, and heard her say,
GENERATED_EN: The king did not dare to speak to her, but he stayed up again the next night. Again she said:

FR: Que devient mon enfant? Que devient mon chevreuil?
GLOSS_LSF: MON ENFANT DEVENIR QUOI ? MON CHEVREUIL DEVENIR QUOI ?
EN: My child my fawn this once I come to see,
GENERATED_EN: What happens to my child? What happens to my deer?

FR: Cette fois suis revenue, jamais ne reviendrai.
GLOSS_LSF: CE SOIR MOI LA MAIS MOI REVENIR JAMAIS
EN: This once I come, and now the end must be.
GENERATED_EN: This time I came back, I will never come back.

FR: Le roi ne put se contenir.
EN: Then the King could contain himself no longer,
GENERATED_EN: The king could not contain himself.

FR: Il s'élança vers elle et dit:
EN: but rushed towards her,
GENERATED_EN: He ran up to her and said:

FR: Tu ne peux être une autre que ma femme bien-aimée!
GLOSS_LSF: TOI MA FEMME PAS QUELQU'UN D'AUTRE
EN: saying, You are no other than my dear wife!
GENERATED_EN: You cannot be any other than my beloved wife!

FR: Elle répondit: Oui, je suis ta femme chérie.
GLOSS_LSF: REINE REPONDRE OUI MOI TA FEMME
EN: Then she answered, Yes, I am your dear wife,
GENERATED_EN: She answered: Yes, I am your beloved wife.

FR: Et, en même temps, par la grâce de Dieu,
EN: and in that moment, by the grace of heaven,
GENERATED_EN: And, at the same time, by the grace of God,

FR: la vie lui revint.
EN: her life returned to her,
GENERATED_EN: life came back to him.

FR: Elle était fraîche, rose et en bonne santé.
EN: and she was once more well and strong.
GENERATED_EN: She was fresh, pink and healthy.

FR: Elle raconta alors au roi le crime que la méchante sorcière et sa fille avaient perpétré contre elle.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE RACONTER ROI SORCIERE MECHANTE PLUS SA FILLE TUER ELLE
GENERATED_LSF: ALORS ROI CRIME MECHANTE SORCIERE FILLE RACONTER PERPETRE
EN: Then she told the King the snare that the wicked witch and her daughter had laid for her.
GENERATED_EN: She then told the king about the crime that the wicked witch and her daughter had perpetrated against her.

FR: Le roi les fit comparaître toutes deux devant le tribunal
GLOSS_LSF: ROI AMENER SORCIER SA FILLE DEVANT TRIBUNAL
EN: The King had them both brought to judgment,
GENERATED_EN: The king had them both brought before the court

FR: où on les jugea.
EN: and sentence was passed upon them.
GENERATED_EN: where they were judged.

FR: La fille fut conduite dans la forêt
EN: The daughter was sent away into the wood,
GENERATED_EN: The girl was led into the forest

FR: où les bêtes sauvages la déchirèrent.
EN: where she was devoured by the wild beasts,
GENERATED_EN: where the wild beasts tore it apart.

FR: La sorcière fut jetée au feu
EN: and the witch was burned,
GENERATED_EN: The witch was thrown into the fire

FR: et brûla atrocement.
EN: and ended miserably.
GENERATED_EN: and burned horribly.

FR: Quand il n'en resta plus que des cendres, le petit chevreuil se transforma
GLOSS_LSF: FEU SORCIERE DISPARAITRE DEVENIR CENDRE CHEVREUIL TRANSFORMER
GENERATED_LSF: PLUS CENDRES RESTER PETIT CHEVREUIL TRANSFORMER
EN: And as soon as her body was in ashes the spell was removed from the fawn,
GENERATED_EN: When there was nothing left but ashes, the little deer turned into

FR: et retrouva forme humaine.
EN: and he took human shape again;
GENERATED_EN: and found human form.

FR: Soeurette et Frérot vécurent ensuite ensemble,
EN: and then the sister and brother lived happily
GENERATED_EN: Soeurette and Frérot then lived together,

FR: heureux jusqu'à leur mort.
EN: together until the end.
GENERATED_EN: happy until they die.
